No joke, this is realtime. And it actually runs good too, at speeds of KSP rockets it runs at 60fps even on 0 planet detail (the setting 0 is considered high, with negative values considered lower). Which is still far beyond the quality of many movies and Star Trek / Stargate episodes.

KSP with similar achievements in the visual department would be my dream game of all time, no question. Not to mention the procedural galaxies (yes plural), infinite exploration potential.

Perhaps not this iteration of KSP, but maybe a sequel or 'three-quel?' in the future.

The russians sure know how to code..

[http://en.spaceengine.org/](http://en.spaceengine.org/)
Unfortunately all SpaceEngine ever looks like to me is a stream of errors flying across the screen and then a catastrophic crash to desktop.
Indeed, if moving at lightspeed. But moving at KSP rocket speeds it\'s fine.
To be honest, I hope it stay quite cartoony, It suits the game very well.

While I think SpaceEngine is amazing and is a lot of fun to relax with, KSP shouldn\'t look like that.

KSP has a very stylised look to it, if it was to look like that then there would be an expectation for the rest of the design to be ultra-realistic.

However, the mechanics of SpaceEngine (procedural generation etc) should definitely be considered in KSP.

Thinking more about it though, if KSP managed to retain its current style while still looking more aesthetically pleasing, that would would be awesome.
